results.title: Quality Street
results.creator_credit: George Stevens, Pandro S. Berman and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in Victorian England, Katharine Hepburn plays the not-so-young Phoebe Throssel, fearing imminent spinsterhood as she watches her favourite suitor head off to the Napoleonic Wars, without leaving a wedding proposal behind. When he returns years later, Phoebe must masquerade as her own high-spirited niece to regain his attention. Also starring Joan Fontaine and Franchot Tone. Based on the play by Sir James M. Barrie.

results.title: Pygmalion
results.creator_credit: Leslie Howard, Anthony Asquith, Gabriel Pascal and Pascal Film Productions
results.brief_description: When Bernard Shaw saw this film of his play Pygmalion, he said to Wendy Hiller who plays Eliza Doolittle, “You’ve nearly wiped my old play off the map.” And you will be impressed and moved by her wonderful portrayal of one of the most famous characters in 20th century theatre. Leslie Howard who co-directed the film with Anthony Asquith, gives a fresh, witty and incisive performance as Professor Higgins.

results.title: Purple haze
results.creator_credit: Rachael Hynes, Katherine Hynes, Ian Stevenson and Bondi Beech
results.brief_description: This documentary follows the story of 5 Jacaranda Queen candidates in the country town of Grafton, NSW, before and after the crowning. It examines all the trials and tribulations of preparing for the ceremony and coping with not only losing, but winning. Their candid experience is reflected against the background of Grafton, a town living through tough economic times, the community expectation of the events, and the impact or relevance it has on their lives. Produced with assistance from the Australian Film Finance Corporation.

results.title: Quadrophenia
results.creator_credit: Franc Roddam, Bill Curbishley, Roy Baird, The Who Films and Polytel
results.brief_description: Jimmy (Phil Daniels) works in the post-office during the day in a job he hates. He lives for the weekends when he gets together with his mod friends, dresses up in sharp suits, pops amphetamine pills and dances to soul and power-pop in London clubs. The group of Mods decide to head down to Brighton for the weekend and while there, getting drunk and getting high on speed, they clash with a rival gang of working-class youth, the Rockers, whose musical tastes run to the legends of the fifties - Elvis, Bill Haley, Chuck Berry et. al. - and whose dress is blue-collar jeans and t-shirts. Set in 1965 and loosely based on The Who’s conceptual album of the same name, “Quadrophenia” is a kinetic film about youth culture, alienation and working class life. Featuring an explosive musical score by The Who, as well as great soul and rock music from the fifties and sixties, “Quadrophenia” is by turns both a perceptive and critical examination of leisure and work. Jimmy’s job confines him to a drudgery like that of his parents. It is a life that he wants to escape. He is free only through the exhilaration of music and drugs. With Sting, Toyah Willcox and Ray Winstone.

results.title: Pure Steam: Featuring the Flying Scotsman in Australia
results.creator_credit: Peter Henshaw, Jim Revitt and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: For almost a year the world’s most famous working steam locomotive, The Flying Scotsman 4472 from Britain, thrilled Australian steam enthusiasts from coast to coast. During 1988/89 4472 visited five Australian States and the Northern Territory. Its spectacular parallel runs, double-heading and solo trips have been brilliantly recorded by camera crews from ABCTV, from the air, trackside and on board.

results.title: Punkline
results.creator_credit: Tony Stevens, Sue Davis and Kali Productions
results.brief_description: Shot at the Crystal Ballroom and Festival Hall during performances of the B 52’s, The Cure, La Femme and The Models, this film provides an observation not of the New Wave performers, but of the people who go to see them. Soundtrack from a tape by Equal Local.

results.title: Punk and its after shocks
results.creator_credit: Wolfgang Buld, Gerd Stein and GRF Productions
results.brief_description: Examines the emergence of punk in Britain during the early 1970’s, the bands that made Punk and the movements that Punk spawned including the ‘New Wave’ movement in music. Interviews band members and musicians who were involved in the punk movement and includes clips of the Sex Pistols, The Clash, The Jam, The Police, Madness, Ian Dury and The Kinks performing live.

results.title: Punching keys
results.creator_credit: Sally Ingleton and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A biting dramatisation of the effects of the new technology in deskilling the female office workforce, alienating women from the products of their labour, and rendering them replaceable by cheaper labour overseas. Cast includes a young Gina Riley.

results.title: Public hangings. Series 1. Ep. 06
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Public hangings”.
Public hangings is a local television program on the arts produced for and broadcast on community television (channel 31) in Melbourne, Australia from 2002. Enjoying a cult following, the program produced by Irish art critic and London gallery director, Andrew MacKenzie, roams the streets of Melbourne in search of opening nights and visual vox pops. The program’s style makes the avant garde accessible and provides an insight into a vibrant underground city culture. In this episode Andrew MacKenzie walks us through “Comic Book Lifestyle” an exhibition as part of the Next Wave Festival at Linden St. Kilda Contemporary Centre for Art that explores the burgeoning underground scene of comics, zine and counter-culture. Irene Sutton is interviewed after the opening of painting exhibition by Rosslynd Piggott at her gallery. Lucy Orta’s large-scale community project “Fluid Architecture” is launched at the Drill Hall. David Rozetski is featured as this week’s video artist.

results.title: Punch-drunk love = Punch drunk love
results.creator_credit: Paul Thomas Anderson, Daniel Lupi, Joanne Sellar, New Line Cinema, Revolution Studios and Columbia
results.brief_description: This is not a typical Adam Sandler comedy. Barry Egan (Sandler) is a novelty business owner who has seven sisters and is looking for love, (even trying phone sex once) but love finds him, sending his very ordered life upside down. Watching “Punch-drunk love” you find a mix of dark humour and seedy characters, coupled with violent behaviour and social dysfunction - but it’s also a romance with colour, mood and music that carries you along and makes you hope for a happy ending. Written and directed by Paul Thomas Anderson, winner of Best Director 2002 Cannes Film Festival for this disquieting film. Cast includes Emily Watson, Philip Seymour Hoffman and Luis Guzman.
